team.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a group of people who play a game or sport together against another group
team.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Bobby Charlton was in the team that won the World Cup.
team.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a group of people who have been chosen to work together to do a particular job
team.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Our success lies in working together as a team.
It was a tremendous team effort.
You need to choose a team leader.
a senior member of the design team
team.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: two or more animals that are used to pull a vehicle
team.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a group of people who play a game or sport together against another group
team.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: China’s football team failed to qualify for the World Cup.
I played for my school cricket team.
He coached the Italian national team.
Hayward then increased the home team’s lead.
The visiting team failed to score.
A member of the opposing team grabbed hold of his shirt.
He has played several times for the first team.
He stepped up from the second team when Roberts was injured.
Everyone on the winning team will get a medal.
He wants to play for a better team.
James captained his school team from the age of eleven.
He was never good enough to make the team.
He has been dropped from the team because of injury.
The cup was presented to the team captain.
a team member/a member of a team
He was a popular member of the team.
Who do you think will be the next England team manager?
In those days, girls didn’t play team sports.
One reason for the 49ers’ success is that they play as a team.
team.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a group of people who have been chosen to work together to do a particular job
team.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: ADJECTIVES/NOUN + team
a management/research/sales etc team
The design team has come up with a few ideas.
a rescue team
He was in the water for two hours before a rescue team arrived.
a good/strong team
We have a very strong sales team.
a three-man/four-man etc team
About a month ago he hired a four-man team of personal trainers.
a 10-strong/14-strong etc team
A six-strong team from the Transport Research Laboratory is at the crash scene.
team + NOUN
a team member/a member of a team
Team members meet on a regular basis.
a team leader
The team leader will co-ordinate the work.
a team effort
It was a great team effort and all the crew did a magnificent job.
a team meeting
Hold team meetings to discuss problems.
lead a team
She was the doctor who led the surgical team.
work as a team
You have to learn to work as a team.
make a good team
You and I make a good team.
team.translation[0].note_box[2].items[0]: Team is usually followed by a singular verb
A team of doctors works at the clinic
team.translation[0].note_box[2].items[1]: A team of doctors work at the clinic
team.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to put two things or people together, because they will look good or work well together
team.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: black trousers teamed with a bright shirt
team.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a group of people who work together to do a particular job
team.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: We have recruited an excellent management team.
